author: Brady Farkas
title: Former Seattle Mariners All-Star Aids M's in Big Way on Thursday
text: Former Seattle Mariners All-Star Aids M's in Big Way on Thursday The Seattle Mariners entered play on Thursday at 5.5 games back in the American League West, but they got a little help from an old friend in their quest to stay alive in the division race. Ty France hit a solo home run for the Cincinnati Reds as they beat the Houston Astros 1-0. France went 9-for-11 in the series against Houston, which the Reds took. The M's are now 5.0 games back of the Astros as they enter their own game against the Oakland Athletics. The 30-year-old France was designated for assignment by the Mariners back in June. He hit just .223 for Seattle with eight home runs. However, he was a valued member of the organization for a number of years since being acquired in a 2020 trade. He helped Seattle break the drought in 2022 and made the All-Star Game that season. Lifetime, he was a .266 hitter with the M's. After latching on with the Reds, France has hit considerably better. He has four home runs now in 31 games. He's also playing in a more hitter-friendly environment at Great American Ball Park. Though the M's got some help from France and the Reds, they sill need to take care of their own business. They can start by beating Oakland on Thursday and then will have to go to St. Louis over the weekend and take on the Cardinals. The [M's ](https://www.si.com/mlb/team/seattle-mariners)have a tough schedule remaining, but they will see the Astros for three games (Sept. 23-25) with a chance to make up further ground then. Follow Inside the Mariners on social media Continue to follow our Inside the Mariners coverage on social media by liking us on [Teren_Kowatsch](https://x.com/Teren_Kowatsch) and @ [wdevradiobrady](https://twitter.com/WDEVRadioBrady). You can subscribe to the "Refuse to Lose" podcast by clicking [HERE:](https://open.spotify.com/show/1oBvJopLughGl4ndijlZPf)

author: Wykop Sp. z o.o.
title: Global Climate Summit Yields Major Agreements
text:
Global Climate Summit Yields Major Agreements
The recent Global Climate Summit held in Geneva saw leaders from over 100 countries converge to discuss pressing environmental issues. Key agreements were reached, including a commitment to reduce carbon emissions by 30% over the next decade. This ambitious target aims to mitigate the effects of climate change, which scientists warn could become catastrophic without immediate action. The summit also highlighted the importance of transitioning to renewable energy sources, with many countries pledging substantial investments in solar and wind power. Additionally, there was a focus on protecting biodiversity, with a landmark agreement to establish more protected areas for endangered species. The conference underscored the urgency of international cooperation, emphasizing that climate change is a global challenge requiring collective effort. While the commitments made are promising, the true test will be in the implementation and enforcement of these policies over the coming years.

author: Binance News
title: Alerte aux logiciels malveillants : Meeten devient Meetio, ce qui constitue une menace pour les utilisateurs de crypto-monnaies
text:
Selon Foresight News, le logiciel malveillant connu sous le nom de Meeten, qui cible les participants aux conf√©rences sur les cryptomonnaies, a √©t√© rebaptis√© Meetio. Ce changement repr√©sente un risque important pour les utilisateurs, car le t√©l√©chargement et l'utilisation du logiciel peuvent entra√Æner des violations de donn√©es et des pertes financi√®res.
Le changement de nom de Meeten en Meetio est une strat√©gie des cybercriminels pour poursuivre leurs activit√©s de phishing sous un nouveau nom. Les utilisateurs sont invit√©s √† faire preuve de prudence et √† rester vigilants face √† de telles menaces. Le logiciel est con√ßu pour tromper les individus et les inciter √† le t√©l√©charger, souvent par le biais d'interactions ou de partenariats apparemment l√©gitimes. Une fois install√©, il peut acc√©der √† des informations sensibles, ce qui peut entra√Æner des fuites de donn√©es et la perte d'actifs num√©riques.
Foresight News conseille aux personnes impliqu√©es dans l'industrie de la cryptomonnaie d'√™tre particuli√®rement prudentes et de mettre en ≈ìuvre des mesures de s√©curit√© robustes pour se prot√©ger contre de telles menaces. Il est crucial pour les utilisateurs de v√©rifier l'authenticit√© de tout logiciel avant de le t√©l√©charger et d'√™tre m√©fiants face aux demandes ou offres non sollicit√©es qui pourraient √™tre des tentatives de phishing. En restant inform√©s et prudents, les individus peuvent prot√©ger leurs donn√©es et leurs actifs contre les acteurs malveillants.

author: Mary Walrath-Holdridge
title: Kathleen Wilson's Minnesota dentist did 30 procedures at once: lawsuit
text:
20 fillings, 4 root canals, 8 crowns in one visit add up to lawsuit for Minnesota dentist Mary Walrath-Holdridge USA TODAY A Minnesota dentist has become the subject of a malpractice lawsuit after his patient accused him of "disfiguring" her.
The civil lawsuit was filed in Hennepin County, Minnesota last week by Kathleen Wilson, who alleged Dr. Kevin Molldrem and Molldrem Family Dentistry caused her significant injury that is still being corrected.
According to the suit, Molldrem performed more than 30 producers on Wilson in a single July 2020 visit, doing eight crowns, four root canals and 20 fillings in one go. The lawsuit alleges that the dentist "perform[ed] this work improperly," resulting in pain and suffering, embarrassment, emotional distress, and disfigurement.
Molldrem was likewise accused of using improper levels of anesthesia during the procedures and falsifying medical records to cover it up.
Treatment called 'inconceivable' Gypsy Rose Blanchard released from Missouri prison early Thursday morning, DOC confirms Cher files for conservatorship of her son, claims Elijah Blue Allman's life is 'at risk' Ex-boyfriend of missing St. Louis woman admits to her murder after Wisconsin arrest: Police 6 dead, 3 injured in Johnson County, Texas, crash; victims include 2 young kids ages 9, 10 California Pizza Huts lay off all delivery drivers ahead of minimum wage increase ‚ÄúIt is inconceivable that Dr. Molldrem could have prepared and placed 8 crowns under these circumstances in the time allotted, not to mention the additional 20 restorations,‚Äù wrote Dr. Avrum Goldstein, a dentist and expert witness brought on by Wilson's attorney, in an affidavit.
Goldstein, who is a faculty member at NOVA Southeastern University , also wrote that Wilson had been correctly diagnosed as having a "rare condition" causing decay in almost all of her teeth, but Mollderm's course of action was not a proper form of treatment.
"[Wilson‚Äôs] required a slow, thoughtful, careful and measured response to her disease,‚Äù he said in his report. ‚ÄúTrying to fill every hole in every tooth in her mouth in one visit is not only the antithesis of what was indicated, it is not humanly possible to achieve in an effective or constructive manner.‚Äù
Doctors remove wrong organ from man: They opened him up to remove his appendix. They mistakenly took out much more, lawsuit says.
The lawsuit also accused Mollderm of tampering with medical records to falsify the amount of anesthesia that was reportedly used, which in reality was nearly double the standard number of units, according to court paperwork. According to Goldstein, the maximum dose of anesthesia given in three hours should not exceed 490 mg, but Molldrem's records show he gave Wilson 960 mg.
‚ÄúAny negative cardiovascular or central nervous system outcomes could be tied to the local anesthetic overdose," he wrote.
Wilson said in the suit that she has since had to have the dental work completely redone by other dentists to repair Molldrem‚Äôs ‚Äúnegligent work," an ongoing process that has caused her to lose income and rack up medical bills on top of enduring pain, suffering and embarrassment. She is seeking more than $50,000 in damages.
Wilson's attorney and Molldrem did not immediately respond to request for comment.
